# backgroundStyle

**Instance Property**

The background style of the child view that contains names and avatars.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var backgroundStyle: SWAttributionView.BackgroundStyle { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you don’t specify a background style, the system chooses one automatically. In general, [doc://com.apple.sharedwithyou/documentation/SharedWithYou/SWAttributionView/BackgroundStyle-swift.enum/color] looks best on monochrome backgrounds, while [doc://com.apple.sharedwithyou/documentation/SharedWithYou/SWAttributionView/BackgroundStyle-swift.enum/material] looks better on colored backgrounds.

## Customizing highlights

- **displayContext**: The context for the content the system displays with this view.
- **highlight**: The highlight you use to display this attribution.
- **highlightMenu**: A menu with a list of system actions specific to this hightlight.
- **horizontalAlignment**: The horizontal alignment of the view.
- **menuTitleForHideAction**: A localized string the system uses as a custom title for the hide menu item.
- **preferredMaxLayoutWidth**: A width the system uses to constrain the view contents.
- **supplementalMenu**: A supplemental menu to augment the attribution view’s existing menu.
